Key Arguments: The submission questions who decides what is true and by what standards.
The author expresses concern that Christian beliefs are increasingly ridiculed and persecuted.
The submission suggests that biblical teachings are being labeled as 'hate speech' and could be classified as misinformation under the new legislation.
The author believes that the legislation is part of a broader societal shift away from Christian values.
Main Themes: Freedom of speech and religious expression
Concerns about censorship and control over truth
Moral and religious implications of legislation
Notable Quotes: This proposed bill to combat 'misinformation and disinformation' is the most concerning bill that I have ever heard discussed in Australia in my seventy five years of reading about our nation's political proposals.
The screaming questions that remain unanswered are who decides what is true and by what standards?
It is blindingly obvious that the teachings of the bible are increasingly hated, and are already branded as 'hate speech' in several jurisdictions in the western world.
